intro: Psychotria andasibeensis, commonly known as the Andasibe Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid environments. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
